io.confluent.ksql.security

Class KsqlDefaultSecurityExtension

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.confluent.ksql.security.KsqlDefaultSecurityExtension
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KsqlSecurityExtension, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class KsqlDefaultSecurityExtension
extends java.lang.Object
implements KsqlSecurityExtension
    This is the default security extension for KSQL. For now, this class is just a dummy implementation of the KsqlSecurityExtension interface.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(KsqlConfig ksqlConfig)
        Description copied from interface: KsqlSecurityExtension
        Initializes any implementation-specific resources for the security extension.
        Specified by:

      • getAuthorizationProvider

        public java.util.Optional<KsqlAuthorizationProvider> getAuthorizationProvider()
        Description copied from interface: KsqlSecurityExtension
        Returns the authorization provider used to verify access permissions on KSQL resources.

        If no authorization is required/enabled for KSQL, then an Optional.empty() object must be returned.
        Specified by:
        getAuthorizationProvider in interface KsqlSecurityExtension
        Returns:
        The (Optional) provider used for authorization requests.

      • getUserContextProvider

        public java.util.Optional<KsqlUserContextProvider> getUserContextProvider()
        Description copied from interface: KsqlSecurityExtension
        Returns the KsqlUserContextProvider used to access to service clients that may be run in the context of a user making REST requests.

        If an empty Optional object is returned, KSQL marks this function as disabled.

        If a non-empty object is returned, KSQL marks this function as enabled.

        Note: This context is used only for non-persistent commands.
        Specified by:
        getUserContextProvider in interface KsqlSecurityExtension
        Returns:
        The KsqlUserContextProvider object. The context is optional, and if an empty object is found, then KSQL will disable the user context functionality.

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: KsqlSecurityExtension
        Closes the current security extension. This is called in case the implementation requires to clean any security data in memory, files, and/or close connections to external security services.
        Specified by:
        close in interface KsqlSecurityExtension
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
